artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Maruya Jinpachi
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 21; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 305.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: seated man in LRQ, wearing blue, with his PR arm outstretched, pulling backward with his body; man in blue with purple medallion patterned skirt standing behind first man, scowling, with both hands on his sheathed sword; another seated man wearing purple garment with purple, light blue and white striped skirt and black trim, leaning forward, in LL; landscape view with trees, water and figures in ULQ
markings: Artist’s seal: 芳年 {Yoshitoshi} | Censor seal: 申四改
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From The Syllabary Copybook of the Treasury of Loyal Retainers (Kanadehon Chūshingura 仮名手本忠臣蔵)
signed: 一魁斎芳年筆 {Ikkaisai Yoshitoshi hitsu}
text: Actors Nakamura Tsuruzō I as Fuwa Kazuemon (R), Nakamura Fukusuke I as Hayano Kanpei (C), and Onoe Baikō IV as Senzaki Yagorō (L). Related to the play Kanadehon Chūshingura 仮名手本忠臣蔵, performed at the Nakamura Theater in the 4th month of 1860.
title: Sixth Act
